etymologies: late 18th century: from medieval Latin oriolus (in Old French oriol), from Latin aureolus, diminutive of aureus ‘golden’, from aurum ‘gold’

definitions: an Old World bird related to the starlings that feeds on fruit and insects, the male typically having bright yellow and black plumage.

notes.text: Family Oriolidae and genus Oriolus: many species, including the golden oriole (Oriolus oriolus)

shortDefinitions: tree-dwelling Old World bird of which male has bright yellow and black plumage

definitions: a New World bird of the American blackbird family, with black and orange or yellow plumage.

notes.text: Genus Icterus, family Icteridae (sometimes called the American oriole family): many species, including the Baltimore oriole

shortDefinitions: New World bird of American blackbird family
